description: Refresh site messaging to establish the yo go brand voice across all user-facing pages without redesign-level visual changes.

userStories.title: define the yo go messaging framework
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want an immediately understandable brand narrative for "yo go" so that I can grasp the product voice without reading command instructions.
acceptanceCriteria: A canonical copy framework is defined for "yo go" with lowercase usage required in all user-facing contexts
The framework defines tone as balanced playful plus technical clarity
The framework avoids imperative command-tutorial phrasing and favors implicit concept framing
Typecheck passes
Lint passes

userStories.title: update homepage and key entry-point messaging
userStories.description: As a new user, I want the homepage language to reflect the yo go concept so that the product purpose feels clearer and more engaging.
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage headline/subheadline and supporting copy are updated to the yo go narrative
Existing design language and component patterns are preserved
Minor layout adjustments are allowed only when needed to improve copy readability or hierarchy
No redesign-level design system or visual theme changes are introduced
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: Homepage copy and hierarchy render correctly after updates in desktop and mobile

userStories.title: align all user-facing pages with yo go terminology
userStories.description: As a returning user, I want consistent terminology across all user-facing pages so that the brand and behavior model feel coherent.
acceptanceCriteria: Brand and product references use "yo go" terminology consistently
Navigation labels, section intros, and page-level messaging use consistent yo go terminology
All user-facing pages in this repository are covered in scope for terminology alignment
Explanations of agent workflow still match actual product behavior
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: Navigation and page content show consistent yo go naming across user-facing routes

userStories.title: validate copy quality and release readiness
userStories.description: As a maintainer, I want a final quality pass on revised messaging so that the site ships with consistent, readable, and intentional tone.
acceptanceCriteria: Revised copy is reviewed for consistency, grammar, and tone
There are no leftover conflicting brand phrases in user-facing pages
Key page metadata/title copy is aligned with yo go naming where applicable
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: Final smoke pass confirms updated messaging and metadata render correctly on key pages
